subject: Programming
title: The Broken Windows Theory
description: A 60-second lesson on The Broken Windows Theory.

hook.text: One broken window in a building signals neglect. Soon, every window gets smashed.

buildup.text: In codebases, one messy function signals that sloppiness is acceptable. Others follow.

discovery.text: The Pragmatic Programmer applied this theory to software: don't tolerate broken code.

twist.text: Fixing a small mess takes minutes. Cleaning up after years of neglect takes months.

climax.text: Culture spreads through code. Leave it cleaner than you found it and quality compounds.

punchline.text: One broken window rots the whole codebase.

quiz.question: What book applied the broken windows theory to software?
